title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**The Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments:
I watched a few episodes of Jupiters Legacy  
BARF. The Blackstar fight was fun but really bad CGI though.  
I will finish it and then read the comic because Netflix will definitely cancel it.


I watched Invincible.   
GOLD  
I read the whole comic.    
Cant wait for S2 and S3   


Heard Castlevania had a big season finale so starting Castlevania S01.


Watched The Mitchells vs The Machines.    
Movie of the Year for me

Why does Bollywood have a problem with giving lesbian characters a good ending. Watched 'Hum bhi akele tum bhi akele' (movie) and 'The Married Woman' (web series) and in both of them. Spolier alert - Central characters who's a lesbian (bi incase of web series) does not end up with her"r because she has to take care of "him". Come on its 2021, can't we have a better storyline with lesbian characters. 

Also on the other note i watched Radhe. Now i am taking break from watching movies.

Saw Vincenzo (netflix) . 8.6 IMDB . Dark comedy which is largely fun but with some quite violent moments . Interesting concept around Evil and justice

Line of Duty . Great series but ending was Mehh
Watched 5th season of Arrested Development. Felt very off.
I watched Sunday Bloody Sunday(1971). Peter Finch was phenomenal. I caught up with the Crown and it’s great.
Castlevania season 4, enjoyed it. Finished half of it within 3 days.
Castlevania has excellent voice casting and great story. Just finishing S4 and it’s still exciting.
I just finished S1. Its amazing. I am mesmerized.
Have you watched The Thick Of It?
I have not. I just thought AD and Veep were very similar in terms of narrative. I didn't look much on the source of veep. Is it like AD ?
Veep is apparently a remake of TToI. Wondering which one I should watch first...
